intro: Linosyris capituliflora, commonly known as the clustered flax, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers arranged in dense, rounded clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Linosyris capituliflora is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
